## Context & Purpose

- What is the purpose of this change?
- What problem does it solve or feature does it add?
- How does it improve the user experience or site functionality?

## Implementation & Design

- Summarize the key technical approach (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Eleventy, etc.).
- Point out any structural, styling, or interactive changes.
- Note any new dependencies or build process changes.

## Impact on Site/User Experience

- How does this change improve the website?
- Does it affect SEO, accessibility, performance, or visual design?
- Are there any user-facing changes that reviewers should be aware of?

## How to Review/Test

- Steps for verifying the changes work correctly.
- Run `npm run build && npm run serve` to preview locally.
- Test responsive layouts at different screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop).
- Check browser console for any errors (F12 â†’ Console tab).
- If applicable: test interactive elements, forms, or navigation.

## Key Decisions & Tradeoffs

- Document major technical, UX, or design tradeoffs.
- Note why alternative solutions were rejected (short bullet points).
- Any performance, accessibility, or browser compatibility considerations.

## Checklist

- [ ] Site builds successfully (`npm run build`)
- [ ] Site serves locally without errors (`npm run serve`)
- [ ] Visual changes tested in browser at different screen sizes
- [ ] No console errors in browser DevTools
- [ ] Links and navigation work correctly
- [ ] Images and assets load properly

## Screenshots/Reference (optional)

- Paste or link relevant screenshots showing before/after (if visual changes).
- Include screenshots at different screen sizes if layout changes were made.
- Link to design mockups or references if applicable.

## Next Steps (optional)

- Note any follow-ups or open questions for future PRs.
